snippet: Anne Gust Brown, a lawyer by training, is often relied upon to predict what her often unpredictable husband, Gov. Jerry Brown of California, is thinking.
abstract: Anne Gust Brown, wife of California Gov Jerry Brown, has not embraced traditional role as first lady, instead functioning as a confidante to her husband and quietly consulting with him on various matters; she is one of the few people who can predict Brown's often unpredictable thinking and, one of the most likely to tell the governor when it is time to stop analyzing and make a decision.
lead_paragraph: Anne Gust Brown, a lawyer by training, is often relied upon to predict what her often unpredictable husband, Gov. Jerry Brown of California, is thinking.

headline.main: Don’t Call Her a First Lady; Brown’s Wife Is His Top Aide
headline.print_headline: Don’t Call Her a First Lady; Brown’s Wife Is His Top Aide
